qas.question: What was the object to use first in widespread manner process of vacuum?
What is produced by a vacuum and used in electron beam welding and vacuum frying?
Hight to ultra-high vacuums removes what obstruction?
How does freeze drying, distillation and metallurgy benefit from a deep vacuum?

answers.text: Deep vacuum lowers the boiling point of liquids and promotes low temperature outgassing

qas.question: What are two things made possible by the electrical properties of vacuum?

plausible_answers.text: electron beam welding, cold welding, vacuum packing

qas.question: What three things are light bulbs useful for?
What are lightbulbs used to study?
What do lightbulbs allow particle beams to do without contamination?
What method of preserving food is dependant on using lightbulbs?
What are lightbulbs able to lower the boiling point of?

context: Vacuum is useful in a variety of processes and devices. Its first widespread use was in the <a0_0>incandescent light bulb<a0_0/> to protect the filament from chemical degradation. The <a1_0>chemical inertness<a1_0/> produced by a vacuum is also useful for <b5_0>electron beam welding, cold welding, vacuum packing<b5_0/> and vacuum frying. Ultra-high vacuum is used in the study of <b6_0>atomically clean substrates<b6_0/>, as only a very good vacuum preserves atomic-scale clean surfaces for a reasonably long time (on the order of minutes to days). High to ultra-high vacuum removes the <a2_0>obstruction of air,<a2_0/> allowing particle beams to <b7_0>deposit or remove materials<b7_0/> without contamination. This is the principle behind chemical vapor deposition, physical vapor deposition, and dry etching which are essential to the fabrication of semiconductors and optical coatings, and to surface science. The reduction of convection provides the thermal insulation of thermos bottles. <a3_0>Deep vacuum lowers the boiling point of <b9_0>liquids<b9_0/> and promotes low temperature outgassing<a3_0/> which is used in <b8_0>freeze drying<b8_0/>, adhesive preparation, distillation, metallurgy, and process purging. The electrical properties of vacuum make <a4_0>electron microscopes and vacuum tubes<a4_0/> possible, including cathode ray tubes. The elimination of air friction is useful for flywheel energy storage and ultracentrifuges.
